title: 106_hr5429
content: The "Researchers and Farmers Freedom From Terrorism Act of 2000" amends penalties for animal enterprise terrorism under Section 1961(1)(B) of title 18, United States Code. Section 43 of title 18, United States Code is amended to increase penalties for maliciously damaging or destroying property used by animal enterprises to a minimum of 5 years imprisonment. In subsection (d)(1), penalties are increased for damaging property used by animal enterprises to a minimum of 5 years imprisonment. Amendments include adding offices or headquarters of the enterprise to the list of punishable acts. SEC. 4. NATIONAL ANIMAL TERRORISM AND ECOTERRORISM INCIDENT CLEARINGHOUSE. The Director will establish a national clearinghouse for information on incidents of crime and terrorism related to animal enterprises, environmental impact on commercial activities, and connections to these enterprises or activities. The clearinghouse will accept and maintain information submitted by various law enforcement agencies. The national clearinghouse for information on crime and terrorism related to animal enterprises and environmental impact will collect, index, and provide information to law enforcement agencies upon request. Information for each incident will include details, suspects, and other relevant information. The clearinghouse for crime and terrorism related to animal enterprises will be user-friendly for law enforcement agencies. The Director will publicize its existence and may utilize resources from other government departments or accept assistance from private organizations. Coordination with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms will be ensured. The term "animal enterprise" is defined as in section 43 of title 18, United States Code. Authorization of Appropriations for fiscal years 2001-2005 is hereby authorized for the Director of the FBI to carry out the clearinghouse for crime and terrorism related to animal enterprises.
